result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Jay Harris Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: With the sentence imposed as to Case# 15CF003348.  Probation may be terminated/discharged by the agent after 36 months if probation sentence has been successfully served and there are no other violations of the law.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay Restitution in the amount of $6,100 to Farkas Automotive during the term of probation.  
*Pay Restitution in the amount of $4,200 to Milwaukee Asian Market, Tou V. during the term of probation.
*Any cash bail posted to be applied to restitution owed.  Restitution to be paid before costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid after restitution has been satisfied.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so).
*If confinement is served - DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.
*Seek/Maintain full-time employment or part-time employment and school.
*Court advises defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

*No Contact Order with the WalMart retail stores at 10330 West Silver Spring Drive in the City of Milwaukee   AND/OR  the WalMart retail store at 6300 West Brown Deer Road in the Village of Brown Deer   AND/OR  the WalMart retail store at 10600 West Layton Avenue, City of Greenfield - this as to Case# 15CM000543.
*No Contact Order with the Glendale Dept. of Public Works - DPW yard at 5910 North Glen Park Road in the City of Glendale - this as to Case# 15CF004235.
*No Contact Order with the Milwaukee Asian Market   AND/OR   Tou V. - as to case not charged.
*No Contact Order with Farkas Automotive at 8008 North Sherman Blvd. in the Village of Brown Deer - as to this case.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  42  months  with  8  days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  18  months; EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  24  months.  

COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of   42  months.  Probation is CONCURRENT to the sentence imposed as to Case# 15CF003348.  Probation may be terminated/discharged by the agent after 36 months if probation sentence has been successfully served and there are no other violations of the law.

-  Court sets Restitution in the amount of $6,100 as to Farkas Automotive
-  Court sets Restitution in the amount of $4,200 as to Milwaukee Asian Market, Tou V.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-  Seek/Maintain full-time employment or part-time employment and school
-  No Contact Order with the WalMart retail stores at 10330 West Silver Spring Drive in the City of Milwaukee   AND/OR  the WalMart retail store at 6300 West Brown Deer Road in the Village of Brown Deer   AND/OR  the WalMart retail store at 10600 West Layton Avenue, City of Greenfield - this as to Case# 15CM000543
-  No Contact Order with the Glendale Dept. of Public Works - DPW yard at 5910 North Glen Park Road in the City of Glendale - this as to Case# 15CF004235
-  No Contact Order with the Milwaukee Asian Market   AND/OR   Tou V.   -  as to case not charged
-  No Contact Order with Farkas Automotive at 8008 North Sherman Blvd. in the Village of Brown Deer - as to this case

-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $6,100 to Farkas Automotive during the term of probation.  
-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $4,200 to Milwaukee Asian Market, Tou V. during the term of probation.
Any cash bail posted to be applied to restitution owed.  Restitution to be paid before costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid after restitution has been satisfied.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  Seek/Maintain full-time employment or part-time employment and school
-  No Contact Order with the WalMart retail stores at 10330 West Silver Spring Drive in the City of Milwaukee   AND/OR  the WalMart retail store at 6300 West Brown Deer Road in the Village of Brown Deer   AND/OR  the WalMart retail store at 10600 West Layton Avenue, City of Greenfield - this as to Case# 15CM000543
-  No Contact Order with the Glendale Dept. of Public Works - DPW yard at 5910 North Glen Park Road in the City of Glendale - this as to Case# 15CF004235
-  No Contact Order with the Milwaukee Asian Market   AND/OR   Tou V.   -  as to case not charged
-  No Contact Order with Farkas Automotive at 8008 North Sherman Blvd. in the Village of Brown Deer - as to this case

-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $6,100 to Farkas Automotive during the term of extended supervision.  
-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $4,200 to Milwaukee Asian Market, Tou V. during the term of extended supervision.
Any cash bail posted to be applied to restitution owed.  Restitution to be paid before costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid after restitution has been satisfied.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
If confinement is served -  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Michael Jay Harris in court with Attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Defendant Michael Jay Harris in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has four cases before the court.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.
Clerk:  jms

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court, defendant Michael Jay Harris not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has four cases before the court.
Defense counsel arrived late in court; Court in trial on an unrelated case.  Case could have been spun to another court, other courts were ready and available to hear case, defense counsel left the courtroom and did not re-contact the court until after 4 p.m., cases could no longer be spun to another court.

Case adjourned for plea and sentencing in branch 28.
